citation.article-title: Krasilnikovia gen. nov., a new member of the family Micromonosporaceae and description of Krasilnikovia cinnamonea sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Krasilnikovia cinnamonea sp. nov.
Krasilnikovia cinnamonea (cin.na.mo'nea L. n. cinnamum cinnamon; N.L. adj. cinnamonea cinnamon-coloured)
Morphological, chemotaxonomic and general characteristics are as given above for the genus description.

The organism shows moderate growth on 1/5 yeast-starch agar, glycerol-asparagine agar, tyrosine agar, sucrose-beef extract agar, ISP medium 6, ISP medium 1, 1/20 V8 juice agar, HV agar, and 1/10 yeast-malt extract agar, and poor growth on nutrient agar and tap water agar.
Melanin pigment production on ISP medium 7 is negative.

Abundant sporulation occurs on glucose-asparagine agar, sucrose-nitrate agar and HV agar media, moderate sporulation on glycerol asparagine agar, tyrosine agar, nutrient agar, Hickey-Tresner agar, yeast extract-starch agar, 1/5 yeast extract-starch agar, ISP medium 1 agar, 1/20 V8 juice agar and 1/10 yeast extract-malt extract agar, and no sporulation on inorganic salts-starch agar, yeast extract-malt extract agar, oatmeal agar, Bennett agar, glucose-yeast extract agar, oatmeal-nitrate agar, sucrose-beef extract agar and ISP medium 6 agar media.
In general, the vegetative mycelia are light melon yellow to cinnamon yellow in colour and aerial mycelia are not present.

Adonitol, L-rhamnose, D-mannitol, α-D(+)melibiose, D-raffinose and trehalose are poorly utilized, and erythritol, L-arabinose, D-ribose, myo-inositol, α-methyl-D-glucoside and lactose are not utilized.
The G+C content of the DNA is 71%.
The type strain is 3-54(41)T (= JCM 13252T = MTCC 8094T).
